newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft CFO sees Forex drag on revenues.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft CFO sees Forex drag on revenues.

text.p: Microsoft Corp Chief financial officer Greg Maffei said he expected the dollar to continue to rise in fiscal 1998 reducing total revenues by about five percent.

At the company's annual financial analyst meeting, Maffei also cautioned that the forthcoming version 5.0 of the company's Windows NT operating system will not be a major factor in the current fiscal year.
Maffei also said he expected sales and marketing expenses to rise as a percentage of revenues for the first time in several years.
Maffei said he expected overall revenue growth in the coming year to be slower than in the past two years when sales were driven by Windows 95 and the Office 97 upgrade.
Microsoft revenues grew 31 percent in the year that just ended and 46 percent in fiscal 1996.
He also said Microsoft executives did not expect next year's Windows 98 upgrade to be anywhere near the blockbuster product that its predecessor Windows 95 was.
Maffei expects Microsoft to continue its stock repurhcase plan in fiscal 1998 but said: "I do not know and I will not say at what price."
Microsoft has said it did not repurchase stock in the fourth quarter due to the high price.
